meaningMnemonic:
You <kanji>enter</kanji> a <kanji>facility</kanji>. So this is your <vocabulary>admission</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>entrance</vocabulary> into that facility. 

入所 is for entering facilities or institutions, often those with names ending in 所, like a 研究所 (research institute). It's also used in prison contexts. You might gain "admission" to prison for not doing your WaniKani reviews, for example, at least in countries ruled by Crabigators...
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
